comment._content:
Actually this photo should be dated prior to 1900: by that date the marble terrace around the base of the U.S. Capitol was complete. In this view one can see the grass terrace and older stairs dating from renovations done by Charles Bulfinch.

Note also the train crossing the Mall at Seventh Street. The curvilinear walks and plantings date from the 1850s when this immediate part of the Mall was laid out by landscape designer A.J. Downing.

comment._content:
this photograph was taken from the Smithsonian Castle building - the tower roof in the foreground is on one of the Castle's towers.  The Arts & Industries Building is further to the right, the south.  The building in this photograph on the extreme right is the DC Armory.  The collections that came to the National Museum from the Centennial Exposition in Philadelphia were stored in the Armory while the A&I was being built.  The Armory is on the site now occupied by the National Air and Space Museum. 

It's a great photograph that I haven't seen before - thanks a lot for posting it.
